title: High Electric Power Losses
description: In 2022, Iraq experienced significant electric power transmission and distribution losses, with 59.25% of output lost, marking one of the highest rates globally.

title: Dependence on Grants and Other Revenue
description: In 2019, grants and other revenue constituted 96.52% of Iraq's total revenue, highlighting a heavy reliance on external financial support.

title: High Incidence of Corruption in Tax Meetings
description: In 2022, 51.2% of firms in Iraq reported expectations to give gifts during meetings with tax officials, indicating prevalent corruption.

title: Dominance of Fuel Exports
description: In 2016, fuel exports accounted for 99.99% of Iraq's merchandise exports, underscoring the country's heavy reliance on the oil sector.

title: Lowest Net Financial Flows from IMF Concessional Loans
description: In 2022, Iraq recorded a net financial flow of -$293,177,789 from IMF concessional loans, indicating a significant outflow compared to other countries.

title: Minimal Net Official Flows from UN Agencies
description: In 2021, Iraq experienced a net official flow of -$108,770 from UN agencies, reflecting a low level of financial support.

title: High Net Incurrence of Liabilities
description: In 2019, Iraq's net incurrence of liabilities reached -1,017,205,485,271.84 LCU, indicating a substantial financial burden.

title: Negligible Social Contributions as Revenue
description: Social contributions accounted for only 0.00045% of Iraq's revenue in 2019, one of the lowest globally.

title: Low Tax Revenue from Goods and Services
description: In 2019, taxes on goods and services contributed just 0.35% to Iraq's revenue, indicating a limited tax base.

title: Minimal Interest Payments as Revenue Percentage
description: Interest payments constituted only 0.0058% of Iraq's revenue in 2019, reflecting low financial obligations in this area.

title: Low Business Insolvency Score
description: Iraq's overall business insolvency score was 6.74 in 2024, suggesting challenges in the business environment.

title: Limited Use of Banks for Business Financing
description: In 2022, only 2.1% of firms in Iraq used banks to finance working capital, indicating limited access to financial services.

title: Low Female Employment and Participation Rates
description: In 2021, the employment to population ratio for females aged 15+ was just 7.72%, highlighting gender disparities in the workforce.

title: Minimal High-Tech Exports
description: In 2022, medium and high-tech exports made up only 0.037% of Iraq's manufactured exports, indicating a lack of technological advancement.
